purpose: Due diligence checklist to make `ph_spec` contracts and examples exhaustive for a flawless execution/implementation phase.

tasks.title: Define contract.md standard template
tasks.description: Define the required sections/headings every ph_spec contract must include (directory purpose, ownership, creation commands, required files, schemas, invariants, validation rules, examples mapping).
acceptance_criteria: A single standard outline exists and is applied consistently across ph_spec contract.md files.

tasks.title: Confirm parking-lot category taxonomy
tasks.description: Decide whether `external-requests` is a real category for the v1 ph layout. If not, remove it from ADR/contract/scaffold and ensure validation/automation rules match the chosen categories.
acceptance_criteria: Allowed categories are explicitly listed and consistent across spec, contract, and validation rules.

tasks.title: Define release lifecycle contract (planning/current/delivered)
tasks.description: Finalize required files and transitions for releases: what lives in planning vs current vs delivered, and what `ph release close` must do (including move semantics and version derivation).
acceptance_criteria: Release file set is fully specified (plan.md/progress.md/features.yaml/changelog.md/etc) and mapped to commands.

tasks.title: Define sprint lifecycle contract (plan/open/close/archive)
tasks.description: Finalize required files/dirs created by sprint lifecycle commands, including `sprints/current` symlink semantics and archive index updates.
acceptance_criteria: Sprint file set (plan.md, retrospective.md, burndown.md, archive/index.json, tasks/* structure) is fully specified and mapped to commands.

tasks.title: Confirm symlink policy for sprints/current
tasks.description: Document how `sprints/current` behaves on platforms without symlink support (Windows) and what fallback is acceptable (text file pointer, directory copy, etc.).
acceptance_criteria: Contract defines canonical behavior plus a fallback strategy if symlinks are unavailable.

tasks.title: Define content vs internal ownership rules
tasks.description: Clarify which files are human-authored vs machine-authored, and which are safe to regenerate, for every subtree under `ph/**`.
acceptance_criteria: Every directory contract identifies ownership and overwrite rules for its files.

tasks.title: Align validation rules with new ph/.ph layout
tasks.description: Review `process/checks/validation_rules.json` assumptions (paths, required structures) and ensure they match the intended ph/.ph layout for general projects.
acceptance_criteria: Validation rule paths and checks align with the v1 ph layout and the ph_spec contracts.

tasks.title: Clarify human vs agent authorship in ownership language
tasks.description: Update ownership terminology so “content” is project-owned (human-directed) even when created/edited by `ph` or AI agents using `ph` inputs.
acceptance_criteria: CONTRACT_TEMPLATE.md and all `ph_spec` contracts use clear “project-owned (human/agent-authored)” wording and overwrite rules remain unambiguous.

tasks.title: Complete spec contract for adr/
tasks.description: Validate example artifacts (if present/required) and write an explicit contract describing what lives here and what commands generate/modify it.
checklist: Review existing examples/ contents; confirm they represent real command outputs.
If examples are missing, decide whether examples are required or optional for this directory (archives may be optional).
Document: purpose, ownership (human vs machine), allowed filenames, required files, schemas/front matter, and link conventions.
Map this directory to the relevant `ph` commands and expected side effects.
Record invariants used by validation (what must exist, what must not).
acceptance_criteria: contract.md contains a complete, unambiguous spec for this directory.
Examples (if used) are reconciled with the contract (no contradictions).
